intro: Gironniera sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. It has small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
